text: Oghi Tehsil is a tehsil or subdivision of the Mansehra District, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province, Pakistan. It is in a mountainous area close to the Kala Dhaka tribal zone. The main or capital town of this tehsil is Oghi. The large part of the population of Oghi tehsil is indigenous Swatis, Gurjars, Awans and a mixture of other smaller groups. Hindko is spoken as the main language by around 62% of the people, Pashto language by some 30% and Gojri by some 8 %.Pakistan National Census 2000-2001 Part of this tehsil is the Agror valley which also used to be the estate of the former Khan of Agror, a famous tribal chieftain. ==References== Category:Tehsils of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Category:Mansehra District
title: Oghi Tehsil
